Competition law provisions in the UK The UK, in common with all Member States, has its own competition provisions modelled on Article 101 and Article 102. These are set out in the Competition Act 1998.

Competition law is a law that promotes or seeks to maintain market competition by regulating anti-competitive conduct by companies. Competition law is implemented through public and private enforcement. Competition law is known as antitrust law in the United States and European Union, and as anti-monopoly law in China and Russia. In previous years it has been known as trade practices law in the United Kingdom and Australia. The history of competition law reaches back to the Roman Empire
